alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Uintah and northeastern Daggett Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 312 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Manila to 24 miles south of Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge to 11 miles north of Vernal. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Uintah and northeastern Daggett Counties. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 363 and 404. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
